issue.title: Build a Markdown Note-Taking API
issue.body:
## Overview
Build a REST API for managing markdown notes with tagging and search.

## Requirements

### Core Features
1. **Note CRUD**
   - Create note with title, content (markdown), and tags array
   - Read single note (returns rendered HTML and raw markdown)
   - Update note title, content, or tags
   - Delete note (hard delete)
   - List all notes with optional tag filter

2. **Tagging System**
   - Notes can have multiple tags (strings)
   - Filter notes by tag
   - Get list of all unique tags with note counts

3. **Search**
   - Full-text search in title and content
   - Case-insensitive matching
   - Returns matching notes sorted by relevance (title matches first)

4. **Markdown Rendering**
   - Convert markdown to HTML on read
   - Support headers, bold, italic, lists, code blocks, links

### Technical Requirements
- TypeScript with strict mode
- Express.js server
- In-memory storage (Map)
- marked library for markdown parsing
- Proper HTTP status codes

### API Endpoints
```
POST /api/notes
  Body: { title: string, content: string, tags?: string[] }
  Response: { id: string, title, content, tags, createdAt, updatedAt }

GET /api/notes
  Query: ?tag=work&search=meeting
  Response: { notes: [...] }

GET /api/notes/:id
  Response: { id, title, content, html, tags, createdAt, updatedAt }

PUT /api/notes/:id
  Body: { title?, content?, tags? }
  Response: { id, title, content, tags, updatedAt }

DELETE /api/notes/:id
  Response: 204 No Content

GET /api/tags
  Response: { tags: [{ name: string, count: number }] }
```

### File Structure
```
src/
  index.ts        # Server setup
  routes.ts       # Express routes  
  storage.ts      # In-memory note storage
  markdown.ts     # Markdown rendering
  search.ts       # Search functionality
  types.ts        # TypeScript types
```

ems.task: Implement core data layer, TypeScript types, and search functionality - build in-memory storage with CRUD operations, define all type interfaces, and implement full-text search with relevance sorting

workers.task: Create TypeScript type definitions in src/types.ts - define Note interface (id, title, content, tags, createdAt, updatedAt), CreateNoteInput, UpdateNoteInput, TagWithCount, and SearchQuery interfaces

Implement in-memory storage in src/storage.ts - create NoteStorage class with Map<string, Note>, add methods: create(input), getAll(), getById(id), update(id, input), delete(id), and getAllTags() with count aggregation

Implement search functionality in src/search.ts - create searchNotes(notes, query) function that performs case-insensitive full-text search on title and content fields, sorts results by relevance (title matches rank higher than content matches), and returns filtered Note array

ems.task: Build markdown rendering service using marked library and configure Express.js routing with all API endpoints, proper HTTP status codes, and query parameter handling
Set up TypeScript project configuration, server initialization, middleware setup, and ensure all modules integrate correctly with proper error handling
